sailpoint.integration

Interface IntegrationInterface

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IntegrationExecutor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractIntegration, sailpoint.integration.AbstractIntegrationExecutor, RemoteIntegration, TraceExecutor

    public interface IntegrationInterface
    Interface that defines the methods that may be supported by an integrated provisioning system.

    There are two default implementations. RemoteIntegration uses a set of REST resources to communicate with the provisioning system. The remote servlet is expected to be implemented with the IIQIntegrationServlet framework or it may be completely custom.

    AbstractIntegration provides a skeleton implementation that appropriate error messages for all methods. This is intended to be subclassed with real implementations of the supported methods. When using the IIQIntegrationServlet, it is registered as the handler class in the web.xml configuration for the servlet.

    NOTE: This is part of the standalone integration jar and must have NO dependencies to IIQ classes other than the ones in this package, and it must NOT use JDK 1.5 features.

    This is extended by sailpoint.object.IntegrationExecutor which adds a few additional methods that are allowed to have dependencies on the IIQ data model, such as the Identity and Bundle classes. Typically integrations will implement IntegrationExecutor or extend AbstractIntegrationExecutor and communicate directly with the target system through a proprietary protocol. If the target system requires an "agent" then it may use the RemoteIntegration framework.

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        void configure(java.util.Map args)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Must be called immediately after construction to provide a set of configuration parameters. The source of these parameters is undefined. For RemoteIntegration they will come from an IntegrationConfig. This not an RPC method, it is only used to pass context into the implementation.

        Map keys must be String. Map values may be any Object but are normally String, Integer, List or other Maps.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • ping

        java.lang.String ping()
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Return some sort of status message. The format of the status message is undefined, the request is considered successful if the return value is non-null. Connection problems will have been caught at a higher level. If we get here and there is something internally wrong throw an exception with an explanatory error message. When using IIQIntegrationServlet an exception will be converted to a 500 HTTP response.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • listRoles

        java.util.List listRoles()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Return the current list of "manageable" roles. This may be all the roles in the system, or it may be a subset depending on configuration in the system. This list will be compared to the list of "exportable" roles in IIQ to determine which role definitions to send.

        This is primarily used to determine which roles need to be deleted by comparing it with the managed role list in IIQ.

        It could in theory be used to filter the set of roles being sent down but it isn't enough since the role could have been modified since it was last sent. In order to filter roles to send we either need the provisioning system to return the modification date with the name (which not be accurate) or we need to remember the last date of push in IIQ somewhere. The later seems more reliable.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addRole

        RequestResult addRole(RoleDefinition def)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Create or update the definition of a role.

        Return a RequestResult with the request details or null for a success.

        Since we have a way to return errors, the implementation should use the message array rather than throwing exceptions.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • deleteRole

        RequestResult deleteRole(java.lang.String roleName)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Delete a role.

        Return a RequestResult with the request details or null for a success.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • provision

        RequestResult provision(java.lang.String identity,
                        ProvisioningPlan plan)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Make changes to an identity defined by a ProvisioningPlan.

        Return a RequestResult with the request details or null for a success.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getRequestStatus

        RequestResult getRequestStatus(java.lang.String requestID)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the current status of the request with the given request ID. The ID is typically obtained from the RequestResult returned by one of the other methods on the IntegrationInterface.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
